title: Trouble using import deeplabcut
body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version**

Please state your operating system, env, and which version of DeepLabCut you are using.
Example: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, with an Anaconda Env, & DeepLabCut1.x or 2.x.

Please complete the following information about your system:

OS: Windows Server 2019
DeepLabCut Version [e.g. 22]: 2.0.8 running in the dlc-windowsGPU environment
Browser: Firefox
Nvidia GeForce RTX 2080 Ti (driver: 436.30)
CUDA: release 10.1, V10.1.243

**Describe the problem**

0) I just recently removed the environment created by dlc-windowGPU.yaml (manually using Anaconda). Below is the EXACT steps i did. 


1) navigate into C:\Users\rasmussen\Desktop\DeepLabCut-master\conda-environments using anaconda command prompt
2) Run the following: conda env create -f dlc-windowsGPU.yaml 

3) Open new anaconda command prompt and run code to activate created environment: 

activate dlc-windowsGPU (environment changes correctly)

4) run following in anaconda cmd prompt: conda install nb_conda
output: # All requested packages already installed.

5) Run ipython and try to import deeplabcut and get an error

```
`In [1]: import deeplabcut
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ModuleNotFoundError                       Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-1-cfa4f159dfc5> in <module>
----> 1 import deeplabcut

ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'deeplabcut'`

6) If I close ipython and navigate to C:\>Users\rasmussen\Desktop\DeepLabCut-master using cd, and then start ipython again to run import deeplabcut i get a different type of error:

`In [1]: import deeplabcut
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ModuleNotFoundError                       Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-1-cfa4f159dfc5> in <module>
----> 1 import deeplabcut

~\Desktop\DeepLabCut-master\deeplabcut\__init__.py in <module>
     18
     19 # DLClight version does not support GUIs. Importing accordingly
---> 20 import matplotlib as mpl
     21 if os.environ.get('DLClight', default=False) == 'True':
     22     mpl.use('AGG') #anti-grain geometry engine #https://matplotlib.org/faq/usage_faq.html

ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'matplotlib'`

7) If I then install matplotlib in the environment (manually using anaconda), to then again start ipython and run import deeplabcut, I get a new error:

`(base) C:\>activate dlc-windowsGPU

(dlc-windowsGPU) C:\>cd Users\rasmussen\Desktop\DeepLabCut-master

(dlc-windowsGPU) C:\Users\rasmussen\Desktop\DeepLabCut-master>ipython
Python 3.6.9 |Anaconda, Inc.| (default, Jul 30 2019, 14:00:49) [MSC v.1915 64 bit (AMD64)]
Type 'copyright', 'credits' or 'license' for more information
IPython 7.8.0 -- An enhanced Interactive Python. Type '?' for help.

In [1]: import deeplabcut
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ModuleNotFoundError                       Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-1-cfa4f159dfc5> in <module>
----> 1 import deeplabcut

~\Desktop\DeepLabCut-master\deeplabcut\__init__.py in <module>
     27     else:
     28         mpl.use('Agg')
---> 29     from deeplabcut import generate_training_dataset
     30     from deeplabcut import refine_training_dataset
     31     from deeplabcut.generate_training_dataset import label_frames, dropannotationfileentriesduetodeletedimages, comparevideolistsanddatafolders, dropimagesduetolackofannotation

~\Desktop\DeepLabCut-master\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\__init__.py in <module>
     17 else:
     18     from deeplabcut.generate_training_dataset.auxfun_drag_label import *
---> 19     from deeplabcut.generate_training_dataset.labeling_toolbox import *
     20     from deeplabcut.generate_training_dataset.multiple_individual_labeling_toolbox import *
     21     from deeplabcut.generate_training_dataset.frame_extraction_toolbox import *

~\Desktop\DeepLabCut-master\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\labeling_toolbox.py in <module>
     12 import os.path
     13 import glob
---> 14 import cv2
     15 import wx
     16 import wx.lib.scrolledpanel as SP

ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'cv2'`

8) Now cv2 is not showing up when i search in anaconda GUI..




**Screenshots**
Sorry, I couldn't upload screenshots to github for some reason. 


**Additional context**
Previously i had the anaconda paths added to the system paths, but these are currently removed. 

Below is the list of packaged installed in the environment.
```

I know it must be frustrating to have me (re)post this trivial problem, but I honestly cannot see where I'm deviating from the guide. In a previous post i was told that I need python 3.6 instead of 3.7. If python 3.6.9 is used in the dlc-windowsGPU environment, does it then matter that a different version is installed on the OS?

Sincerely,
Peter
